programmes.show_name: Devil in Disguise: John Wayne Gacy
programmes.show_description: A psychiatrist uncovers Gacy's dark history as Tovar and Kozenczak examine how systems failed to stop his murders, and a romance develops between Billy Kindred and Mary Jane. Drama, starring Michael Chernus and Gabriel Luna
Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host as the amateur designers face the challenges of menswear week, with Mark Wright the guest judge joining M&S lead designers and customers to decide who will have the chance of winning the life-changing prize
James cooks up a feast of delicious food for singer Freya Ridings and sports presenter Jill Douglas, while there are also recipes from chefs Sat Bains and Dipna and Gulu Anand

Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by magician Pete Firman, with Shivi making a breakfast of courgette, basil and ricotta on toast with a frozen tomato granita, while Jimmy creates mini beef and ale pot pies. Plus, Shivi visits a city farm in the shadow of Canary Wharf, Jimmy fulfils a childhood dream at a cowboy ranch in Florida, and crafter Sarah Ashby-Bassett shows how to bling up boots
A round-up of the latest headlines

programmes.show_name: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programmes.show_description: Actress Greta Scacchi and comedian and actor Ardal O'Hanlon join Alan for a chat, while horticulturist Ashley Edwards celebrates everything great about the orchid. There is a spotlight on the special bond between sheepdogs and farmers, and it's the return of the prestigious Wine and Fizzy Tipples Awards, aka the Waftas

Another camera crew arrive on the farm as Liz and Kelvin appear on Lorraine Kelly's show, before they share the good news of Ginger's pregnancy with the children. Kelvin has mixed feelings about the imminent departure of cow Sonic, and a new cockerel arrives on the farm for breeding season
Round-up of the latest headlines

programmes.show_name: Julia Bradbury's Wonders of the Frozen South
programmes.show_description: Julia sails to the rugged island of South Georgia, which rises from the South Atlantic and has an extraordinary abundance of wildlife and a haunting human history. Landing on Salisbury Plain, Julia navigates to reach a vast colony of more than 100,000 king penguins that crowd the beach, as well as the whaling station that became polar explorer Ernest Shackleton's salvation, and sees some of the largest seals in the world
A weekly round-up of royal news, with expert analysis from ITV News' royal editor Chris Ship and expert Lizzie Robinson, and guests

France v Italy (Kick-off 3.10pm). All the action from the match in the third round of fixtures, held at Stade Pierre Mauroy in Lille. Italy have never won on French soil in this competition and they fell to a heavy 74-23 defeat in Rome when the teams met last year. However, while Les Bleus will fancy their chances of retaining the title they won in 2025, the Italians got off to a winning start in round one against Scotland and will be looking to again demonstrate how much they have improved in recent years with a competitive display this evening

Bradley Walsh hosts as Lance Ellington, Beth Tweddle, Bob Champion and Sally Lindsay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught
Round-up of the latest headlines

Just 25 players are left as Rob Brydon hosts another tense round of quick-fire quiz duels, with each win expanding a player's territory, while each loss sends another home. With a £5,000 Floor bonus on the line and a £50,000 jackpot up for grabs at the end of the series, it's all to play for as friends turn to foes and challenge one another

programmes.show_name: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programmes.show_description: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with the four lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

Working-class woman Jane Andrews wants more for her life and is unlucky in love. On the brink of losing all hope, she receives a letter inviting her to interview for a job with Sarah, Duchess of York, at Buckingham Palace. Securing the job, she moves to London - but life in the palace is gruelling and Jane struggles to fit in, but she and Sarah find common ground in their experiences of love and betrayal. Fact-based drama, starring Mia McKenna-Bruce and Natalie Dormer
Round-up of the latest headlines

Prue is joined by actress Sophie Winkleman, making her a chicken pie using hot-water crust pastry, then prepares an oxtail stew and dumplings served with frozen mashed potato. Meanwhile, her husband John heads out to the garden to catch up with gardener Philippa, and Prue's food hero this time is a northern Chinese restaurant that is making waves in south Wales.
Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

Another camera crew arrive on the farm as Liz and Kelvin appear on Lorraine Kelly's show, before they share the good news of Ginger's pregnancy with the children. Kelvin has mixed feelings about the imminent departure of cow Sonic, and a new cockerel arrives on the farm for breeding season
Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features
Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.
A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions
Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective
The key headlines from the day so far

David Dickinson and his team are in Stoke-on-Trent, assessing items including a collection of 500 vinyl records, a painting that has been in the loft for 40 years and a valuable haul of gold sovereigns

Ranvir Singh hosts the quiz as Chirag and Krupa, Maia and Wendy, and Abby and David take on Riddlemaster Henry Lewis as they attempt to answer general knowledge questions and confusing conundrums. Only one team will make it through to the high-stakes final with a chance to win a cash prize

Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

Bradley Walsh hosts as Gillian from Glasgow, Vanessa from Rochdale, Dean from London and Sanj from Stoke-on-Trent work as a team to take on one of the experts in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught
By the Scottish Green Party
A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

There is an emergency on the farm when a ewe becomes sick, Kelvin readies the older piglets for market and a visit to A&E is in order after a run-in with a wasp's nest. A kitten becomes the newest member of the household and it is party time as Kelvin pulls out all the stops for a surprise birthday bash for Liz's 40th
Joe wants to seek revenge on Cain, while Aaron reaches out to Bear, and Ross reckons he has a foolproof plan
Mal locks Bernie in the cafe to declare his feelings, Debbie instructs Ronnie to transfer cash to Carl, and Steve hears news of his dad for the first time in years

Jane meets dashing businessman Luis Castillo and the two begin a relationship, but tensions soon erupt on a holiday in Greece and she becomes increasingly unstable. As Jane's carefully constructed composure starts to fracture and puts her position with the duchess at risk, a lifeline appears in the shape of the charismatic Tommy Cressman
A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents
Current affairs show tackling the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective, with studio debate and analysis of major stories
